## Exercise 1
The triangular distribution, in the interval $(a,b)$, is given by the following:
$$
f(X) = 
\begin{cases}
\frac{2(x-a)}{(b-a)(c-a)} & a \leq x < c\\
\frac{2(b-x)}{(b-a)(b-c)} & c \leq x \leq b\\
0 & \text{otherwise}
\end{cases}
$$
where $c \in [a,b]$.
